page.title: 10PULLOXHILL PLAYERS
page.content: The Players originated from a small group of women meeting to put on entertainments in a shelter in the village.From such small beginnings, now a group of about 45 men,women and children meet every Thursday evening to put on plays,variety shows and pantomimes.The Pulloxhill Players can create their own scenery,costumes and props.from within their membership.Occasionally they perform outside the village when requested- this is called "Outside Broadcasts". Junior members often stay on to become full adult members. Currently adult membership is Â£2.00p.a. and Juniors pay 50p per performance. The Players now use the village hall where there is a small stage and a tiny dressing room for everyone to share.Ashed houses the props.
